trans.tran_other: to enter a place in a large group and keep control of it, especially by military force

sentences.content: Students occupied Sofia University on Monday.
sentences.tran: 星期一学生们占领了索非亚大学。

sentences.content: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.tran: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

trans.tran_other: very severe pain

sentences.content: the agony of arthritis
sentences.tran: 关节炎的剧烈疼痛

trans.tran_other: the raised place beside a railway track where you get on and off a train in a station

sentences.content: The Edinburgh train will depart from platform six.
sentences.tran: 开往爱丁堡的火车将从六号站台发车。

sentences.content: a small raised platform at one end of the room
sentences.tran: 房间一端凸起的小讲台

sentences.content: an oil exploration platform
sentences.tran: 石油勘探平台

trans.tran_other: a political system in which the government controls the production of all food and goods, and there is no privately owned property

sentences.content: the ultimate triumph of communism in the world
sentences.tran: 共产主义在全世界的最终胜利

trans.tran_other: used to make a word, statement, or question negative

sentences.content: Most of the stores do not open until 10 am.
sentences.tran: 大多数商店要到上午10点才开始营业。

sentences.content: She’s not a very nice person.
sentences.tran: 她为人不太好。

sentences.content: You were wrong not to inform the police.
sentences.tran: 你没有通知警方是错误的。

sentences.content: ‘Can we go to the park?’ ‘No, not today, dear.’
sentences.tran: “我们能去公园吗？”“不，今天不行，亲爱的。”

trans.tran_other: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

sentences.content: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.tran: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.content: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.tran: 紧张谈判的一天

trans.tran_other: used to say that something may happen or may be true but you are not certain

sentences.content: Maybe it’s all just a big misunderstanding.
sentences.tran: 也许这只是一个很大的误会。

sentences.content: ‘Do you think he’ll come back?’ ‘Maybe.’
sentences.tran: “你认为他会回来吗？”“也许会吧。”

sentences.content: Maybe they’re right, but maybe not .
sentences.tran: 也许他们是对的，但也许不是。

sentences.content: You have talent, maybe even genius.
sentences.tran: 你很有才能，甚至可以说有天赋。

sentences.content: He said he’d finish the work soon – maybe tomorrow.
sentences.tran: 他说他很快就会完成那项工作——也许是明天。

trans.tran_other: a strong feeling of dislike, annoyance, or disapproval

sentences.content: Joan looked at him with disgust.
sentences.tran: 琼厌恶地看着他。

trans.tran_other: to use something for a particular purpose

sentences.content: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
sentences.tran: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

trans.tran_other: when someone or something is protected

sentences.content: the protection of the environment
sentences.tran: 环境保护

trans.tran_other: to join two or more things together

sentences.content: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.tran: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.content: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.tran: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。
